snippet: The Michigan House approved part of a package that would ultimately bar workers from being required to pay union fees; the state Senate has passed two similar bills.
abstract: Michigan House approves part of a package that would ultimately bar workers from being required to pay union fees; State Senate has passed two similar bills; effort in Michigan is only latest in what has become wave of renewed interest in such legislation over past two years, particularly as states search for ways to emerge from the economic downturn and attract new business.

byline.original: By STEVEN YACCINO and MONICA DAVEY
byline.contributor: Steven Yaccino reported from Lansing, Mich., and Monica Davey from Chicago. Steven Greenhouse contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Michigan House approved part of a package that would ultimately bar workers from being required to pay union fees; the state Senate has passed two similar bills.

headline.main: Bills Placing Limits on Unions Advance in Michigan Legislature
headline.print_headline: Bills Placing Limits on Unions Advance in Michigan Legislature
